pull apart.translation[0].definitions[0]: Pull the meat apart with two forks.
pull apart.translation[0].definitions[1]: to make the relationships between people in a group bad or difficult
His drinking pulled the family apart.
pull apart.translation[0].definitions[2]: to carefully examine or criticize something
The selection committee pulled each proposal apart.
pull apart.translation[0].definitions[3]: to separate people or animals when they are fighting
The fight ended only when the referee pulled the two players apart.
pull apart.translation[0].definitions[4]: if something pulls apart, it breaks into pieces when you pull on it
